1212            "}\n" +
1213            "void main()\n" +
1214            "{\n" +
1215            "  vec4 tgt = texture2D( u_texture, v_texCoords );\n" +
1216            "  vec3 lab = rgb2lab(linear(tgt.rgb));\n" +
1217            "  lab.x = lab.x + v_color.r - 0.5372549;\n" +
1218            "  lab.yz = lab.yz + (v_color.gb - 0.5) * 2.0;\n" +
1219            "  gl_FragColor = vec4(sRGB(clamp(lab2rgb(lab), 0.0, 1.0)), v_color.a * tgt.a);\n" +
1220            "}";
1221
1222    /**
1223     * Makes the colors in the given textures almost-grayscale, then moves their chromatic channels much closer to the
1224     * batch color, without changing the lightness. The result is almost all the same hue as the batch color, and can be
1225     * gray if the batch color is any grayscale color. This uses an RGB batch color for simpler usage in most code that
1226     * doesn't already use colorful-gdx. There is some contribution from the original texture, so even if the batch
1227     * color is gray, then the result will probably have some very muted colors. I hope this shader is... bearable.
1228     * <br>
1229     * You can generate RGB colors using any of various methods in the {@code rgb} package, such as
1230     * {@link com.github.tommyettinger.colorful.rgb.ColorTools#rgb(float, float, float, float)}.
1231     * <br>
1232     * Meant for use with {@link #vertexShader}.
1233     */
1234    public static String fragmentShaderColorize =
1235            "#ifdef GL_ES\n" +
1236                    "#define LOWP lowp\n" +
1237                    "precision mediump float;\n" +
1238                    "#else\n" +
1239                    "#define LOWP \n" +
1240                    "#endif\n" +
1241                    "varying vec2 v_texCoords;\n" +
1242                    "varying LOWP vec4 v_color;\n" +
1243                    "uniform sampler2D u_texture;\n" +
1244                    "const vec3 forward = vec3(1.0 / 3.0);\n" +
1245                    "void main()\n" +
1246                    "{\n" +
1247                    "  vec4 tgt = texture2D( u_texture, v_texCoords );\n" +
1248                    "  vec3 base = mat3(+0.2104542553, +1.9779984951, +0.0259040371, +0.7936177850, -2.4285922050, +0.7827717662, -0.0040720468, +0.4505937099, -0.8086757660) *" +
1249                    "              pow(mat3(0.4121656120, 0.2118591070, 0.0883097947, 0.5362752080, 0.6807189584, 0.2818474174, 0.0514575653, 0.1074065790, 0.6302613616) \n" +
1250                    "              * (tgt.rgb * tgt.rgb), forward);\n" +
1251                    "  vec3 tint = mat3(+0.2104542553, +1.9779984951, +0.0259040371, +0.7936177850, -2.4285922050, +0.7827717662, -0.0040720468, +0.4505937099, -0.8086757660) *" +
1252                    "              pow(mat3(0.4121656120, 0.2118591070, 0.0883097947, 0.5362752080, 0.6807189584, 0.2818474174, 0.0514575653, 0.1074065790, 0.6302613616) \n" +
1253                    "              * (v_color.rgb * v_color.rgb), forward);\n" +
1254                    "  tint.x = clamp(base.x, 0.0, 1.0);\n" +
1255                    "  float blen = length(base.yz);\n" +
1256                    "  blen *= blen;\n" +
1257                    "  tint.yz = clamp(tint.yz * (0.7 + blen) + base.yz * (0.3 - blen), -1.0, 1.0);\n" + // change 0.7 and 0.3 to, say, 0.85 and 0.15 to reduce the original image's contribution
1258                    "  tint = mat3(1.0, 1.0, 1.0, +0.3963377774, -0.1055613458, -0.0894841775, +0.2158037573, -0.0638541728, -1.2914855480) * tint;\n" +
1259                    "  gl_FragColor = vec4(sqrt(clamp(" +
1260                    "                 mat3(+4.0767245293, -1.2681437731, -0.0041119885, -3.3072168827, +2.6093323231, -0.7034763098, +0.2307590544, -0.3411344290, +1.7068625689) *\n" +
1261                    "                 (tint * tint * tint)," +
1262                    "                 0.0, 1.0)), v_color.a * tgt.a);\n" +
1263                    "}";
1264
1265    /**
1266     * Makes the colors in the given textures almost-grayscale, then moves their chromatic channels much closer to the
1267     * batch color's chromatic channels, without changing the lightness. The result is almost all the same hue as the
1268     * batch color, and can be gray if the batch color is any grayscale color. The lightness of the batch color is used
1269     * to determine how strong the effect should be; you may want to use an out-of-gamut color for very strong tint
1270     * effects, because those need to be light and the lightest gamut is just one point. This uses an Oklab batch color.
1271     * There is some contribution from the original texture, varied based on the batch lightness, so even if the batch
1272     * color is gray, then the result will probably have some very muted colors.
1273     * <br>
1274     * You can generate Oklab colors using any of various methods in the {@code oklab} package, such as
1275     * {@link com.github.tommyettinger.colorful.oklab.ColorTools#oklab(float, float, float, float)}.
1276     * <br>
1277     * Meant for use with {@link #vertexShader}.
1278     */
1279    public static String fragmentShaderColorizeOklab =
1280            "#ifdef GL_ES\n" +
1281                    "#define LOWP lowp\n" +
1282                    "precision mediump float;\n" +
1283                    "#else\n" +
1284                    "#define LOWP \n" +
1285                    "#endif\n" +
1286                    "varying vec2 v_texCoords;\n" +
1287                    "varying LOWP vec4 v_color;\n" +
1288                    "uniform sampler2D u_texture;\n" +
1289                    "const vec3 forward = vec3(1.0 / 3.0);\n" +
1290                    "void main()\n" +
1291                    "{\n" +
1292                    "  vec4 tgt = texture2D( u_texture, v_texCoords );\n" +
1293                    "  vec3 base = mat3(+0.2104542553, +1.9779984951, +0.0259040371, +0.7936177850, -2.4285922050, +0.7827717662, -0.0040720468, +0.4505937099, -0.8086757660) *" +
1294                    "              pow(mat3(0.4121656120, 0.2118591070, 0.0883097947, 0.5362752080, 0.6807189584, 0.2818474174, 0.0514575653, 0.1074065790, 0.6302613616) \n" +
1295                    "              * (tgt.rgb * tgt.rgb), forward);\n" +
1296                    "  vec2 tint = v_color.gb - 0.5;\n" +
1297                    "  base.x = clamp(base.x, 0.0, 1.0);\n" +
1298                    "  float blen = length(base.yz);\n" +
1299                    "  blen *= blen;\n" +
1300                    "  base.gb = clamp(tint * (v_color.r + blen) + base.yz * (1.0 - v_color.r - blen), -1.0, 1.0);\n" +
1301                    "  base = mat3(1.0, 1.0, 1.0, +0.3963377774, -0.1055613458, -0.0894841775, +0.2158037573, -0.0638541728, -1.2914855480) * base;\n" +
1302                    "  gl_FragColor = vec4(sqrt(clamp(" +
1303                    "                 mat3(+4.0767245293, -1.2681437731, -0.0041119885, -3.3072168827, +2.6093323231, -0.7034763098, +0.2307590544, -0.3411344290, +1.7068625689) *\n" +
1304                    "                 (base * base * base)," +
1305                    "                 0.0, 1.0)), v_color.a * tgt.a);\n" +
1306                    "}";
1307
1308}
